results.title: The Lemonade stand: what's fair?
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses the illustration of two boys who open a lemonade stand in order to present a study of the meaning of commitment, obligations, and responsibility to others. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Leith Ratten case
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall, Murray Travers and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation of the trial and conviction of Leith Ratten for the murder of his wife in Shepparton in 1970. Examines the events preceeding the trial and reexamines the evidence. Stars Danny Adcock and Julie Dawson.

results.title: The LEGO Movie character design
results.creator_credit: Animal Logic, Grant Freckelton and Chris
results.brief_description: Over 40 years before Emmet declared “Everything is awesome!” in The LEGO Movie, two kids in a basement created awesome stop-motion animation with LEGO bricks. These fan-made shorts, known as ‘brickfilms’, were a huge influence on The LEGO Movie team.

constellations_primary.name: Stop-motion fantasies
constellations_primary.description: The LEGO Movie draws on fan-made stop-motion films for its aesthetic style, but fantastical animation comes in many forms.

results.description: Long before Emmet declared “Everything is awesome!” in The LEGO Movie, people all over the world proved that you could create awesome stop-motion animation with LEGO bricks. In fact, ‘brickfilms’ were a huge influence on The LEGO Movie directors Phil Lord and Chris Miller and Animal Logic, the Australian studio who created the animation for the 2014 smash hit. Though the film is entirely computer generated (CG), the filmmakers wanted the realistic LEGO look of brickfilms, so they made sure the sets could physically be made from real bricks and the characters only moved the way LEGO does in real life. This authenticity extended to how the CG characters were designed - you’ll notice that Emmet, Lucy, Batman and the whole gang are covered in fingerprints, dust and scratches – just like real LEGO!
description_for_label: Long before Emmet declared “Everything is awesome!” in The LEGO Movie, people all over the world proved that you could create awesome stop-motion animation with LEGO bricks. In fact, ‘brickfilms’ were a huge influence on The LEGO Movie directors Phil Lord and Chris Miller and Animal Logic, the Australian studio who created the animation for the 2014 smash hit. Though the film is entirely computer generated (CG), the filmmakers wanted the realistic LEGO look of brickfilms, so they made sure the sets could physically be made from real bricks and the characters only moved the way LEGO does in real life. This authenticity extended to how the CG characters were designed - you’ll notice that Emmet, Lucy, Batman and the whole gang are covered in fingerprints, dust and scratches – just like real LEGO!

results.title: The Lego Movie
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros. Pictures, Warner Bros. Animation, Phil Lord, Christopher Miller and Animal Logic
results.brief_description: An ordinary Lego mini-figure, mistakenly thought to be the extraordinary MasterBuilder, is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil Lego tyrant from gluing the universe together.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros. Pictures, Warner Bros. Animation, Phil Lord, Christopher Miller and Animal Logic
results.description:
An ordinary Lego mini-figure, mistakenly thought to be the extraordinary MasterBuilder, is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil Lego tyrant from gluing the universe together.

Phil Lord and Christopher Miller’s 2014 stop-motion animation blockbuster had audience declaring “Everything is awesome!” when it took the world by storm in 2014. Finally bringing the entire, beloved LEGO universe together in a family-friendly romp, it both delighted new viewers and rekindled nostalgia in lovers of the world-famous brick toys. Featuring an all-star cast, including Chris Pratt, Will Ferrell, Elizabeth Banks, Will Arnett, Nick Offerman, Alison Brie, Liam Neeson, and Morgan Freeman, it arrived “at a time when feature animation was looking and feeling mighty anemic…The LEGO Movie shows ‘em how it’s done”, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

It has since spawned a spin-off, The Lego Batman Movie (2017) and a direct sequel, The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part (2019). In our new exhibition, The Story of the Moving Image, we take an in-depth look at character design by Animal Logic.
description_for_label:

Featuring an all-star cast, including Chris Pratt, Will Ferrell, Elizabeth Banks, Will Arnett, Nick Offerman, Alison Brie, Liam Neeson, and Morgan Freeman, it arrived “at a time when feature animation was looking and feeling mighty anemic…The LEGO Movie shows ‘em how it’s done”, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

It has since spawned a spin-off, The Lego Batman Movie (2017) and a direct sequel, The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part (2019). In our new exhibition, The Story of the Moving Image, we take an in-depth look at character design by Animal Logic.

results.title: The Legends of Malibu
results.brief_description: Relive the magic of Malibu as legendary surfers document the birth of a lifestyle, a cultural revolution based on sunshine, surfing and good vibrations. Featuring renowned surfers such as Mike Doyle, Wayne Miyata, Lance Carson, Mickey Dora, Mike Hynson and hosted by the legendary Corky Carroll, featuring music by The Beach Boys, The Surfaris and Surf Raiders.

results.title: The Legendary Rex
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The Rex Theatre, in Charlton, was built in 1938 and opened with the film ‘Mary, Queen of Scots’. David Pollard, who worked as a projectionist at the theatre since 1980, takes us on a tour of this historic theatre. He is the Chairperson of the Charlton Community Theatre and has been working towards getting The Rex into community ownership, as there is not a large population base for the theatre to be commercially viable.
The community has offered voluntary labour and raised over $80,000 and with the help of fundraising from the federal government, it is hoped the theatre will eventually be completely in the hands of the community.

results.title: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
results.brief_description: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time reveals the genesis of the fantasy land of Hyrule, the origin of the Triforce, and the tale of the first exploits of Princess Zelda and the heroic adventurer Link. Vibrant, real-time 3-D graphics transport you into the fantasy world of Hyrule. Your quest takes you through dense forests and across wind-whipped deserts. Swim raging rivers, climb treacherous mountains, dash on horseback across rolling hills, and delve into dungeons full of creatures that fight to the finish to put an end to your adventures. With immersive graphics, a sweeping story line, swashbuckling adventure, mind-bending puzzles, and a touch of humor, The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time is one of Nintendo’s most epic challenges ever.
results.title_for_label: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time

results.title: The Legend of Zelda
results.brief_description: Set in the fantasy land of Hyrule, the plot centers on a boy named Link, the playable protagonist, who aims to collect the eight fragments of the Triforce of Wisdom in order to rescue Princess Zelda from the antagonist, Ganon.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Significant sounds
constellations_other.description: The arrival of synchronised sound dramatically changed the movie business, allowing filmmakers to use sound in new and exciting ways which developed the use sound into own film language.

results.description: Set in the fantasy land of Hyrule, the plot centers on a boy named Link, the playable protagonist, who aims to collect the eight fragments of the Triforce of Wisdom in order to rescue Princess Zelda from the antagonist, Ganon. During the course of the game, the player sees Link from a top-down perspective and must navigate him through the overworld and several dungeons, defeating enemies and finding secrets along the way.

results.title: The Legend of the pied piper
results.brief_description: One of a series of films in which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. This film is an adaptation of the well-known fairy story of how the master musician drove the rats from the city of Hamelin.
